700931f-a.title: Bronx: Tremont Avenue (East - Unionport Road
700931f-a.folder: Tremont Avenue (East & Unionport Road, Bronx, NY

701932f-c.title: Bronx: Unionport Road - Tremont Avenue (East)
701932f-c.text:
(1)
Unionport Road, south from near E. Tremont Avenue, showing.
on the east side of the thoroughfare, the New York Catholicc
protectory shortly prior to demolition. On the site will be
erected the huge housing project to be constructed by the
Metropolitan Life IInsurance Company.
April 10, 1938
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
Another view of the Catholic Protectory buildings as seen
from White Plains Road, near E. Tremont Avenue.
April 10, 1938
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTICNS
(3)
A view of the Protectory's high wall enclosure, on the
east side of Unionport ROad, as seen from Virginia Avenue.
In bhe background is the Protectory's church.
ARriil 13, 1938
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

Sept. 4, 1939

701933f-b.title: Bronx: Unionport Road - Tremont Avenue (East)
701933f-b.text:
(1)
Unionport Road (vantage-point), east side, between East Tremont
Ave. and Baker Ave., showing the storage yard of the Starck-Rawlings
Company. The point of vantage is the bridge over the tracks of the
New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad.
July 18, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A view of the Starck-Rawlings yard from a different angle.
July 18, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
